headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GILBERT, SIDNEY IRWIN

docs.snippet: GILBERT--Sidney Irwin, born February 17, 1925, Died peacefully on April 30, 2014. He leaves behind his loving wife of 63 years, Betty, his devoted daughters Enid and Leslye, his sons-in-law, Richard Katze and Mitchell Funk, and his adored grandchi...
docs.lead_paragraph: GILBERT--Sidney Irwin, born February 17, 1925, Died peacefully on April 30, 2014. He leaves behind his loving wife of 63 years, Betty, his devoted daughters Enid and Leslye, his sons-in-law, Richard Katze and Mitchell Funk, and his adored grandchildren Samantha, Josh and Courtney.

docs.lead_paragraph: MATES--Jack Kenneth. Died April 19th, 2014. Formerly President and CEO of Velcro USA. Formerly President, Chairman, Chairman Emeritus of Distinguished Flying Cross Society (DFCS). Donations in lieu of flowers, to DFCS Scholarship Fund, PO Box 502408, San Diego, CA 92150.

docs.snippet: GOLDSMITH--Marilyn. November 28, 1926, on April 6, 2014. Beloved wife of the late Will Goldsmith. James Madison HS, LIU (BA, MA, Teacher). Award-winning poet. Taproot, Performance Poets Assoc., L.I. Writers Guild. Lovingly remembered: Nancy, Georg...
docs.lead_paragraph: GOLDSMITH--Marilyn. November 28, 1926, on April 6, 2014. Beloved wife of the late Will Goldsmith. James Madison HS, LIU (BA, MA, Teacher). Award-winning poet. Taproot, Performance Poets Assoc., L.I. Writers Guild. Lovingly remembered: Nancy, George, Steve, Kate, Lauren, Dan, Rafaella, Eli, Sarah, Lydia, Hannah. Donations: Marilyn Goldsmith Poetry Award c/o James Madison H.S., 3787 Bedford Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11229.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  NEWBERRY, SAMUEL R.

docs.snippet: NEWBERRY--Samuel R.,departed peacefully on April 22, 2014 in Queens, NY. He is predeceased by his wife Alberta, parents and 13 siblings. Mr. Newberry came to Jamaica, NY at age 16. He was passionate about his antique shows, and business "Ye Old Tr...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWBERRY--Samuel R.,departed peacefully on April 22, 2014 in Queens, NY. He is predeceased by his wife Alberta, parents and 13 siblings. Mr. Newberry came to Jamaica, NY at age 16. He was passionate about his antique shows, and business "Ye Old Treasure Shoppe." View: 10am. Funeral: 11am, May 7, New Apostolic, 9914 Francis Lewis Blvd., Hollis, NY. May his soul rest in perfect peace.

docs.snippet: BERKE--Arnold, born November 15, 1923, died April 27, 2014 in Redding, CT. Son of the late George and Ella Berkowitz. Survived by his wife Marjorie; children George, Gregory and Debbie (Fitts); granddaughter Lyndsey Fitts and sister Regina Brauer ...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERKE--Arnold, born November 15, 1923, died April 27, 2014 in Redding, CT. Son of the late George and Ella Berkowitz. Survived by his wife Marjorie; children George, Gregory and Debbie (Fitts); granddaughter Lyndsey Fitts and sister Regina Brauer and children. His spirit sails free on gentle wind. Service Saturday, May 3, 2014, 4:30pm, Unitarian Church of Westport, CT.

docs.snippet: BEHRMAN--Fay. Passed away at 93 years of age in New York. Her extraordinary life spanned ten decades and three continents. She was a nurse for the Red Cross during and after World War II, during which time she cared for Holocaust survivors in the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: BEHRMAN--Fay. Passed away at 93 years of age in New York. Her extraordinary life spanned ten decades and three continents. She was a nurse for the Red Cross during and after World War II, during which time she cared for Holocaust survivors in the Dachau concentration camp. She was whip-smart, elegant, opinionated, vivacious and deeply loyal. Fay loved South Africa (where she was born and raised her family), the arts, fine meals, her walks in Central Park and, above all, her family - to whom she was incredibly devoted. She adored them; and they adored her. Foremost among her devoted admirers were her late husband, Errol, her late son, Darryl and her son, Grant, who survives her. She is also survived by her daughters-in-law, Janine (Alan) and Shelley; her grandchildren Doug (Andrea), Kimmie, Amanda (Zac), and Greg (Caitlin); and her great-grandchildren Josh, Julia, Charlie, and Claire. All of them will miss her dearly, will forever cherish their precious memories of love and laughter with her, and will be graced with the honor of always being able to carry her indomitable spirit with them.

docs.snippet: BAER--Theodore, 87, passed away peacefully April 26th in Southold, NY. Loyal and caring husband for 65 years to his beloved soulmate, his heart, his everything, the late Bertina Baer. In each other's arms again, with extraordinary grace and beauty...
docs.lead_paragraph: BAER--Theodore, 87, passed away peacefully April 26th in Southold, NY. Loyal and caring husband for 65 years to his beloved soulmate, his heart, his everything, the late Bertina Baer. In each other's arms again, with extraordinary grace and beauty, they dance together to songs that now only they can hear. "Teddy Baer" as he was affectionately known, served a distinguished clientele for over 50 years as a jeweler where he was esteemed for his integrity, generosity and skill. His handsome elegant attire, heart-warming smile and many kindnesses will live long in the memories of those who knew him. He is survived by sons Andrew and Nolan, daughter-in-law Colleen Griffin, cousin Alan Baer, nephews Jeffrey and Barry Neichen, and half-siblings Arlene and Arthur Isaacs. Memorial service to be held in Manhattan at a future date. For information please call (212) 397-4822.

docs.snippet: BRILL--Betty, born April 17, 1921, died April 28, 2014. Wife of the late Martin Brill. Survived by her sons Walter, Peter, and Steven; daughters-in-law Gerrilyn, Krista, and Elaine; grandchildren Rachel, Natalie, David, and Lauren. Betty lived a w...
docs.lead_paragraph: BRILL--Betty, born April 17, 1921, died April 28, 2014. Wife of the late Martin Brill. Survived by her sons Walter, Peter, and Steven; daughters-in-law Gerrilyn, Krista, and Elaine; grandchildren Rachel, Natalie, David, and Lauren. Betty lived a wonderful life for an extraordinary 93 years. She was a lover of New York culture, travel, and most of all family and friends. All of them will miss her dearly, will cherish their precious memories of love and laughter, and forever remember her spirit of always caring for others.

docs.snippet: BERNSTEIN--Phyllis. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Phyllis Bernstein, beloved wife of the late Irving. Her commitment to the Jewish community has impacted many lives. We extend our deepest condolences to Phyllis's children, Barba...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERNSTEIN--Phyllis. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Phyllis Bernstein, beloved wife of the late Irving. Her commitment to the Jewish community has impacted many lives. We extend our deepest condolences to Phyllis's children, Barbara Bloom (Myron) and Steven (Diane); her grandchildren; and the entire family. Alisa R. Doctoroff, President; Linda Mirels, Chair of the Board; John S. Ruskay, Executive VP & CEO

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BRINKMANN, ELISABETH RSCJ

docs.snippet: BRINKMANN--Elisabeth RSCJ, educator at the Convent of the Sacred Heart, died Tuesday, April 29. Born June 12, 1960 in Geneva, Switzerland, to Leo and Ursula Brinkmann, she is survived by her mother, Ursula Brinkmann of Austin, her sister, Anne Bir...
docs.lead_paragraph: BRINKMANN--Elisabeth RSCJ, educator at the Convent of the Sacred Heart, died Tuesday, April 29. Born June 12, 1960 in Geneva, Switzerland, to Leo and Ursula Brinkmann, she is survived by her mother, Ursula Brinkmann of Austin, her sister, Anne Birch, and two brothers, Peter Brinkmann and Johannes Brinkmann. Her father predeceased her. Visit www.rscj.org. Funeral Mass 10:00am, Friday, May 9th, Convent of the Sacred Heart, 91st Street, New York. Burial in the Society of the Sacred Heart Cemetery at Kenwood in Albany, May 10.
